message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS 

This paper deals with a sequential decision-making problem in which an algorithm learns user preferences from feedback on presented items. The Bayesian linear model used to model user preferences is a common technique in machine learning and falls under the category of probabilistic graphical models, which is covered in cs.LG. The problem of information filtering is closely related to information retrieval (cs.IR) and recommender systems (cs.AI), which are also likely sub-categories. The use of upper confidence bounds and dynamic programming in the proposed policies suggests a connection to bandit algorithms and optimization, which are covered in cs.SI and cs.DS, respectively.
